intro: Strebanthus tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaf strebanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in regions of South Africa and Namibia. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open grasslands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
